Landmark toll motorway opens The UK's road network reaches a watershed with the opening of the country's first toll motorway. http://news.bbc.co.uk/go/click/rss/0.91/public/-/1/hi/england/staffordshire/3298789.stm
Five die in Moscow suicide blast At least five people are killed in an explosion in Moscow, which is being described as a botched suicide bombing. http://news.bbc.co.uk/go/click/rss/0.91/public/-/1/hi/world/europe/3302765.stm
Osbourne hurt in quad bike smash Rock singer Ozzy Osbourne is in a comfortable condition in hospital after a quad bike crash. http://news.bbc.co.uk/go/click/rss/0.91/public/-/1/hi/entertainment/showbiz/3302405.stm
Iraq car bomb wounds 41 troops Forty-one American soldiers are injured in northern Iraq in a car bomb attack at a US army base. http://news.bbc.co.uk/go/click/rss/0.91/public/-/1/hi/world/middle_east/3302629.stm
Blair criticises Zimbabwe 'chaos' Tony Blair is updating MPs on the talks which prompted Zimbabwe to pull out of the Commonwealth. http://news.bbc.co.uk/go/click/rss/0.91/public/-/1/hi/uk_politics/3303253.stm
Property tycoon cleared by court Property baron Nicholas van Hoogstraten is formally cleared at the Old Bailey of killing a business rival. http://news.bbc.co.uk/go/click/rss/0.91/public/-/1/hi/uk/3303315.stm
Drive to increase patient choice More powers for pharmacists and fast track diagnostic centres are among measures to increase patient choice in the NHS. http://news.bbc.co.uk/go/click/rss/0.91/public/-/1/hi/health/3300949.stm
Call for long-term mortgages UK home buyers are unaware of the benefits of long-term fixed-rate mortgages, a Treasury review of the housing market finds. http://news.bbc.co.uk/go/click/rss/0.91/public/-/1/hi/business/3302029.stm
Humans 'could survive Mars visit' Measurements taken by Nasa's Mars Odyssey craft suggest humans could survive a mission to Mars' surface. http://news.bbc.co.uk/go/click/rss/0.91/public/-/1/hi/sci/tech/3302375.stm
Rugby: No rest for heroes England's Rugby World Cup winners have little time to rest following Monday's victory parade. http://news.bbc.co.uk/go/click/rss/0.91/public/-/sport1/hi/rugby_union/3302915.stm
Football: Euro preview Chelsea and Man Utd look to secure top spot in their groups - plus a look ahead to all Tuesday's games. http://news.bbc.co.uk/go/click/rss/0.91/public/-/sport1/hi/football/champions_league/3300601.stm
Chiluba on trial for corruption Zambia's former President Frederick Chiluba, goes on trial for the alleged theft of more than $40m. http://news.bbc.co.uk/go/click/rss/0.91/public/-/1/hi/world/africa/3302751.stm
Japan backs Iraq troops dispatch Japan agrees a controversial plan to send non-combat troops to Iraq, its biggest deployment since WWII. http://news.bbc.co.uk/go/click/rss/0.91/public/-/1/hi/world/asia-pacific/3301093.stm
Gore 'to back Dean for Democrats' The former vice president is to endorse Howard Dean as the US Democrats' best choice to run in 2004. http://news.bbc.co.uk/go/click/rss/0.91/public/-/1/hi/world/americas/3302595.stm
Key ETA suspect is held in France A suspected military leader of the Basque separatist group ETA is arrested in France. http://news.bbc.co.uk/go/click/rss/0.91/public/-/1/hi/world/europe/3302941.stm
